text: Edward Holland Jr. (born October 30, 1939) is an American singer-songwriter, and record producer. He was a member of Holland–Dozier–Holland. He wrote many popular songs that were sung by Martha and the Vandellas, The Supremes, The Four Tops, and The Isley Brothers. Holland also wrote the songs for the First Wives Club musical. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:Living people Category:American funk singers Category:American soul singers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:Singers from Detroit Category:Writers from Detroit Category:American record producers
title: Eddie Holland
